intro: Arrojadoa eriocaulis, commonly known as the silky hairgrass, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its leaves are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Arrojadoa eriocaulis typically grows in wet, marshy areas and is adapted to thrive in humid, tropical climates.
